item.title: PREFATORY NOTE
item.description: When I accepted the proposal of the publishers to contribute an introduction to the Tantrāloka some time back, I welcomed the opportunity to reacquaint myself with the most towering personality of the medieval India. But, when face to face with the text, I could easily gather that it was a sheer case of overestimation of my capacities. In addition to other failings I was confronted with one very serious handi- cap. I did not know Italian into which R. Gnoli translated the Tantrāloka.* This has remained a cons- tant drawback.
